sub_title: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling
summary:
Co-founder BEYOND WALLS I Curator History & Art projects I Researcher I Historian I Advisor
www.suzannerastovac.com I www.beyondwallscollective.com 

BEYOND WALLS is an Amsterdam-based and globally active collective of curators, researchers, artists and (visual) storytellers. Founded by Glenda Pattipeilohy, Armando Ello, Jeremy Flohr and Suzanne Rastovac.

We believe in the power of storytelling and art to educate and inspire beyond historical facts. 

The combination of research, arts and storytelling is key to our work.

➖
We initiate and participate in collaborative projects that structurally embed community-centered voices: from public programming, exhibitions, community projects and documentaries, to research, artistic interventions, and advice. 

Beyond Walls addresses the entanglement of personal stories, colonial history and today’s world that we live in. This involves engaging with the impact and afterlives of colonialism/coloniality and unequal power structures, racism and questions on identity and belonging. 

Beyond Walls believes in the power of research, storytelling and art as ways to connect on intellectual as well as emotional levels when it comes to colonial legacies. The collective aims for long- term partnerships and structural impact both within and beyond the walls of institutions.
➖

My background lies in colonial history and International Relations (BA and MA) with a specialization in the colonial and contemporary history of the former Dutch East Indies/Indonesia. In 2022 I completed the Maria Lugones Decolonial Summer School, led by Walter Mignolo, Jean Casimir and Rolando Vazquez.

I lived in Malaysia where I completed a minor in postcolonial history at the Universiti Sains Malaysia in Penang. Worked in Southeast Asia and developed music education programs for young adults throughout Java and Bali. In Ambon I worked on music projects and filmed a documentary on the role of poetry and arts in the reconciliation proces after the 1999-2002 conflict.

Expertise & interests: • concept development • research • cross-disciplinary heritage projects • long term (community-based) partnerships • international collaboration • inclusive & intersectional approach • network projects • advise • participatory programming • visual storytelling • directing & producing • project management • publicity campaigns

projects.title: THE SOILS PROJECT x Beyond Walls
projects.description:
Beyond Walls x Tarra Warra Museum of Art, Melbourne Australia x Van Abbemuseum Eindhoven.  Struggles for Sovereignty Yogyakarta 

Beyond Walls is a proud fellow partner in The Soils Project: an experimental research, discursive and exhibition project organised by Van Abbemuseum Eindhoven, TarraWarra Museum of Art near Melbourne and Struggles for Sovereignty based in Jogjakarta. Together with fellow artists, writers and academics, the team will build the Soils Project as an investigative process into how art can offer ways of promoting well-being in the broadest terms, while challenging ongoing acts of extraction and exploitation linked to colonization. The project looks for ways to act ethically and with care towards its different hosts, their histories and contemporary needs. 

The title derives from the Four Soils conceptualized by the Palestinian writer and mathematician Munir Fasheh. They are earth soil, cultural soil, communal soil, and affection-spiritual soil. These are the soils that humans must nurture so that the soils can nurture all life on the planet in return. Cultural and artistic forms can help this nurturing by making it tangible and desirable. At its best, art helps people build relationships with each other without flattening the differences of identity, geography and history. It can link people back to the soils on which they stand, to the uniqueness of their places and to the whole ecosystem that is life’s support system. 

SOILS will lead to two exhibitions: fall/winter 2023 in Tarra Warra Museum of Art, a festival organised by Struggles For Sovereignty and a final exhibition in Van Abbemuseum in 2024.

projects.title: DICHTER BIJ ONZE KOLONIALE ERFENIS
projects.description:
Poetry and film series Read Our Colonial Inheritance is now online! With artists, writers and storytellers Joshua Timisela, Manuwi C Tokai, Kevin Groen and Nisrine Mbarki.

Read Our Colonial Inheritance invites poets, writers, and spoken word artists to create an artistic reflection inspired by a theme and an 'object' from the exhibition 'Our Colonial Inheritance' that resonate with their stories. The artists perform their work in an intimate setting around their chosen 'object' in the exhibition space. Beyond Walls co-facilitated, documented, and captured the process, including the intimate live performances, followed by talks afterward. Beyond Walls has transformed this all into a series of poetic short films that echo the impact of our colonial inheritance and call upon colonial institutions to respond.

Read Our Colonial Inheritance is developed and produced by Beyond Walls, Het Tropenmuseum and Read My World.

projects.title: AFTERLIVES OF REVOLUTION - Rijksmuseum x Beyond Walls
projects.description:
EXHIBITION SERIES AFTERLIVES OF REVOLUTION  
The Rijksmuseum invited Beyond Walls to develop, direct and produce ten personal film portraits of a diversity of descendants of the Revolusi. These portraits were part of the exhibition Revolusi! Indonesia independent by the Rijksmuseum. 

BEYOND WALLS stands for centering the diversity of lived experiences beyond the dominant narratives of nation-states. This approach was reflected in the concept and selection of the stories. 

From Sumatra, Java and Bali to the Moluccas, Sulawesi and The Netherlands. The ten personal stories show the diversity of lived experiences and impact of the Revolusi on people’s lives, beyond the grand narratives of nation-states. 

For BEYOND WALLS it is key to co-create and collaborate with present-day Indonesia throughout the whole proces.  

We collaborated with filmmakers Lexy Rambadeta, Rikky Muhammad Fajar and Novindra Dhiratara Kiran. Production crew: Bagaskara Niartanaya, Venna Agniasari, Yusuf Pambudi, Valentinus Rommy and Felix Dody. On Bali in collaboration with filmmakers Peter Mariouw Smit and Mike Wennekes and interviewer Ni Ketut Sudiani. With special thanks to Anne-Lot Hoek. Production crew Netherlands: Beyond Walls, Danny La Haye (soundscapes), Feba Sukmana (translation), Lara Nuberg (interviews NL), Pim Hermans (camera), David Karels (camera), Maarten Wolff (camera). 

Now online via www.rijksmuseum.nl

Impact

The exhibition REVOLUSI and film portraits were visited by over 120.000 people. Online the ten films were watched fully by over 500.000 people worldwide, mainly from Indonesia.

projects.title: Erfgoed in Beweging I Een programmareeks in het kader van koloniaal erfgoed
projects.description:
ERFGOED IN BEWEGING I Een programmareeks van Beyond Walls over de actuele betekenis van koloniaal erfgoed. Met 31 oktober het eerste programma i.s.m. de OBA Amsterdam met een inleiding van Imara Limon, Richard Kofi in gesprek met Amanda Pinatih, Raki Ap en Yopi Abraham uit de documentaire DIASPORA en een multimediale performance van Robin Block en Jeremy Flohr. Vooraf een viewing van DIASPORA (optioneel). Aanmelden via de OBA Amsterdam.

ERFGOED IN BEWEGING Erfgoed verbonden aan het koloniale verleden is volop in beweging. Van de recente demonstraties rondom het standbeeld van J.P. Coen, de komst van de Gouden Koets naar het Amsterdam Museum tot de nationale politiek dat momenteel met de Commissie Koloniale Collecties beleidskaders ontwikkelt rondom de omgang met (verzoeken tot) teruggave van koloniaal erfgoed. 

Deze ontwikkelingen onderstrepen dat koloniaal erfgoed in alle lagen van de samenleving springlevend is. Maar welke stappen zijn er dan eigenlijk gezet? Hoe kunnen we zowel binnen als buiten de institutionele muren zorgen voor verankering van meerstemmigheid die aansluit op de wereld van nu? 

Tijdens het programma gaan we in op deze vragen en meer. We kijken naar Nederland, maar ook over de grens. Imara Limon, curator bij het Amsterdam Museum gaat in haar inleiding in op deze thematiek. Programmamaker, curator en kunstenaar Richard Kofi gaat in gesprek met de drie uit DIASPORA: Amanda Pinatih, Conservator Vormgeving bij het Stedelijk Museum en PhD kandidaat, Raki Ap, educator en activist en Yopi Abraham, kunstenaar en founder Awareness Moluccan Identity. Tijdens deze avond ook de primeur van MANUAL FOR THE DISPLACED: het multidisciplinaire performance project van spoken word artiest Robin Block en visual storyteller Jeremy Flohr over de vraag: wat is er voor nodig om je ergens thuis te voelen? Hoe ontwikkel je je identiteit tussen landen en vlaggen in? In hun performance geven zij woord, klank en beeld aan deze vragen.

www.beyondwallscollective.com

projects.title: Nationale Herdenking 15 Augustus 2015 - 2020
projects.description:
Als curator Programmering ben ik tussen 2015 en 2021 verantwoordelijk geweest voor de artistiek-inhoudelijke programmering van de Nationale Herdenking 15 augustus. Mijn focus lag op de huidige generaties met roots in Indonesië, de Molukken en Papua die op een eigen manier invulling en betekenis geven aan 15 augustus. In de vorm van Talks, hedendaagse kunst, pop-upexposities, interviewseries en media campagnes worden vanuit de mensen zelf antwoorden verkent op de vraag: 'Wat betekent 15 augustus voor mij?'

Artistieke programmering omvatte:

- artistieke programmering
- serie filmportretten
- moving portraits van artiesten
- pop-uptentoonstellingen zoals PERANAKAN i.s.m. fotograaf Kevin Kwee (2019)
- publieksprogramma op 15 augustus
- online campagnes 
- strategie en advies

Voor overzicht van alle jaren ga naar suzannerastovac.com

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: BETA DISINI x Beyond Walls x Museum Maluku
projects.description:
BETA DISINI.
I am here. 

National Livestream & Community collaborations 

Beyond Walls joined forces with Museum Maluku to create a Live program on March 21, around 70 years of Moluccan presence in The Netherlands. This period marks the arrival of large groups of Moluccan families as a result of the independence war exactly 70 years ago. Hosted by Rocky Hehakaija and Jeftha Pattikawa. With collaborations in the Netherlands, Portugal and Maluku.  

Beyond Walls created BETA DISINI in collaboration with Moluccan communities in the Netherlands in Vaassen, Vught, Ommen, Tiel, Ridderkerk and Rotterdam and Ambon, Maluku & beyond to show the world: BETADISINI. 

BEYOND WALLS developed the program concept, curated and produced the program and visuals, which consisted of 8 Live items on 8 different locations throughout The Netherlands and Ambon, Maluku. Parts of the visuals produced by Beyond Walls were broadcasted by NOS.

projects.title: Erfgoed onder Vuur: het pistool van Raymond Westerling
projects.description:
Een podcast van de Open Universiteit in samenwerking met Beyond Walls.. Met o.a. Joss WIbisono, Caroline Drieënhuizen, Jazzy Taihuttu en Harm Stevens. 

Op een sokkel of in het depot? 
De Colt .32 was het favoriete wapen van de Nederlandse kapitein Raymond Westerling. De man die tijdens de Indonesische Revolutie verantwoordelijk was voor duizenden doden op Zuid-Sulawesi. Momenteel wordt het wapen tentoongesteld in het Nationaal Militair Museum.

Hoe moet je met een dergelijk controversieel object omgaan? Hoort een wapen dat verwijst naar massamoorden wel thuis in een museum? En zo ja, hoe presenteer je dit dan en met welk verhaal? 

Historica Caroline Drieënhuizen en politiek filosoof Marieke Borren gaan in gesprek met Joss Wibisono, journalist en onderzoeker, Harm Stevens, conservator van het Rijksmuseum, Dirk Staat, conservator Nationaal Militair Museum en Jazzy Taihuttu, kunsteducator en regie-assistent van de film De Oost. 

Maand van de Geschiedenis 
Erfgoed onder Vuur is een productie van Beyond Walls en de Open Universiteit in het kader van de Maand van de Geschiedenis. Op dinsdag 27 oktober wordt deze podcast gelanceerd via www.ou.nl. Blijf op de hoogte en volg ons via social media en www.ou.nl.

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: DIASPORA I Heritage in Motion I Documentaire
projects.description:
DIASPORA I Heritage in motion

On August 15 The Netherlands commemorated the end of WWII in the former colony Dutch East Indies. This year exactly 75 years ago. For Indonesia August 17 is an important historical date and marks the birth of Republic Indonesia. At the same time the story is bigger. The aftermath of colonialism, war and decolonization still has impact on people today.

What does colonial heritage mean to a younger generation with roots in Indonesia living in the Netherlands? How do they relate to (historical) objects connected to this era?

Amanda Pinatih, Design curator Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam and PhD candidate, Raki Ap, educator and activist & Yopi Abraham, artist and co-founder of Awareness Moluccan Identity share their perspectives. Narrator: curator and researcher Sadiah Boonstra. Contemporary dance by Cheroney Pelupessy. 

#BeyondWalls 

Concept & directed by Beyond Walls (Suzanne Rastovac)
Camera & Edit 		Jeremy Flohr
Camera 				Armando Ello
					Lexy Rambadeta
					Elinde Kersbergen
Light & sound		Armando Ello 
Production leader 	Glenda Pattipeilohy 

Narrator.                  	Dr. Sadiah Boonstra
Participants			Amanda Pinatih
					Raki Ap
					Yopi Abraham
Contemporary dance	Cheroney Pelupessy	
Performed on ‘What I Will’ by poet Suheir Hammad. Tifa and drums, Yopi Abraham 

In collaboration with: 
City of Amsterdam
Museum Nasional Jakarta
The National Maritime Museum
Tropenmuseum
Het Scheepvaartmuseum
The National Archives
Moluccan Historical Museum
Private collection Amanda Pinatih 
Private collection Family Putinela-Badjo

Special thanks to: Rita Ouédraogo, Wayne Modest, Pim Westerkamp, medewerkers depot, Henry Timisela, Wilhelmina Putinela-Badjo, dochter Putinela, Hilde Manus van der Jagt – Ruygt, Jacqueline Visser, Sandra Scherpenisse, Alexandra Nederlof.

This production was made possible by the 4th and 5th of May Committee Amsterdam Southeast with support by Amsterdam City Council.

projects.title: Huizen van Aankomst (New Homes) I Concept, curator & project leader
projects.description:
Ontmoetingsprogramma Huizen van Aankomst (conceptontwikkeling ism Partizan Publik / Curator en projectleider)

Hoe maak je de impact van iets groots als migratie voelbaar hoe geef je de namen, pijlen en jaartallen een gezicht? Aan de huizen, barakken, hotels, pensions en andere plekken waar ruim 350.000 mensen tussen 1945 – 1968 aankwamen, zijn de talloze (oorlogs)verhalen verbonden die de impact van oorlog en migratie invoelbaar maken. Met het ontmoetingsprogramma Huizen van Aankomst brengen we huidige bewoners en de buurt in contact met de toenmalige bewoners en de verhalen verbonden aan de plek. Verhalen die onderdeel vormen van een bredere wereldgeschiedenis. Een project over WOII, migratie, belonging en identiteit in de wereld van nu.

75 Huizen en verhalen open voor publiek 
Elke plek vertelt een persoonlijk verhaal, een ander perspectief. Op 15 augustus 2020 laten wij een breed publiek kennismaken met deze diversiteit aan perspectieven en verhalen door 75 plekken door heel Nederland open te stellen voor publiek. Door middel van verschillende programma’s, rondleidingen, films, pop-up expo's, lezingen, performances en debatten op diverse locaties willen we de huidige bewoners in contact brengen met de verhalen van mensen toen én nu verbonden aan de plek. Op deze wijze brengen we WOII en migratiegeschiedenis in de woonkamers van alle mensen en wordt de impact van kolonialisme, migratie en oorlog invoelbaar voor een breed publiek.

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: Blinde Vlekken (Blind Spots)
projects.description:
BLINDE VLEKKEN (concept / curator with Wereldmuseum Rotterdam)

An interactive public program series about representation of colonial heritage in museums. How is the colonial past visually and textually represented? What perspectives are (un)visible? ‘Blinde Vlekken’ is part of an ongoing process of deconstructing (colonial) frames and stereotypes in museums and ourselves.
A collaboration with Wereldmuseum Rotterdam. 

Check: https://www.wereldmuseum.nl/nl/zien-en-doen/activiteiten/dossier-indie-blinde-vlekken-1

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: Gepeperd Verleden - Multidisciplinair publieksparticipatieproject
projects.description:
GEPEPERD VERLEDEN (concept & projectcurator)
Actuele thema’s in een breder perspectief

Ons gedeelde koloniale verleden is de afgelopen jaren op allerlei manieren actueel in de samenleving. Meerstemmige perspectieven vormen wezenlijk onderdeel bij duiding van dit verleden en de betekenis daarvan nu. In 2018 is het Indisch Herinneringscentrum gestart met Gepeperd Verleden: een nieuwe programmareeks rondom dekolonisatie, verzet, migratie, racisme en slavernij. Actuele thema’s die soms verhitte discussies opleveren, maar van belang zijn om samen met elkaar te voeren.

Dit project bestond uit:
- Een interviewserie waarin researcher en historica Lara Nuberg het land in trok om diverse museum- en cultuurprofessionals, ervaringsdeskundigen en mensen op straat te interviewen rondom de thematiek. 
- Reeks van 6 publieksprogramma's i.s.m. Tropenmuseum, RCMC, Scheepvaartmuseum, Museum Volkenkunde, Moluks Historisch Museum en Mapping Slavery.
- Artistieke reflecties van o.a. Smita James, Francesca Pichel en Jooz. 

Met Gepeperd Verleden onderzochten we het spanningsveld tussen vaak botsende perspectieven over thema’s als herdenken, representatie van erfgoed en herinnering in onderzoek, archieven, musea en de publieke ruimte. Met uitwisseling tussen erfgoedprofessionals, makers, kunstenaars en onderzoekers vanuit diverse disciplines. 

Samenwerkingspartners: Het Tropenmuseum, Museum Volkenkunde, Research Center for Material Culture, Tong Tong Fair, Het Scheepvaartmuseum, Moluks Historisch Museum & Mapping Slavery.

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: De Geest Overwint 2018
projects.description:
De Geest Overwint (productie/regie shortdocs en fotocampagne & curator Middagprogramma Nationale Herdenking 15 augustus) 

In 2018 was het thema van de Nationale Indiëherdenking ‘De Geest Overwint’. Het is een ode aan de veerkracht van een generatie die de mentale kracht had om op te staan tegen onvrijheid en geweld. Een ode aan dat wat ons tot de dag van vandaag verbindt – de overstijgende kracht van de menselijke geest.

Check: https://www.suzannerastovac.com/projects/visualstorystelling

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: Verhalen Over Leven I Regie en productie shortdocus & curator programmering
projects.description:
Het thema van de Nationale Indiëherdenking 2017 was Verhalen Over Leven en gaat over de onbegrensde kracht van verhalen, over de mens achter de geschiedenis. Over hoe persoonlijke verhalen van zowel overlevenden als zij die tijdens de Japanse bezetting van Nederlands-Indië het leven lieten, doorleven in de huidige en komende generaties.

Verhalen Over Leven bestond uit:
- serie filmportretten
- pop-uptentoonstelling 
- publieksprogramma op 15 augustus
- online campagne

In 2017 is het 75 jaar geleden dat Japan Nederlands-Indië binnenviel. Het begin van een tijd vol angst, dreiging en onzekerheid. De Japanse bezetting betekende een keerpunt in de geschiedenis en het leven van vele mensen. Verhalen Over Leven zoomt in op de persoon achter de historische gebeurtenissen en geeft de geschiedenis een gezicht. Wie waren deze mensen? Waar droomden zij van? Wat gaf hen kracht en moed? Hoe wisten zij onder de meest erbarmelijke omstandigheden - zowel binnen als buiten het kamp - te overleven? En, welke rol spelen deze verhalen in het leven van mensen nu?

Verhalen Over Leven belicht het onsterfelijke karakter van verhalen. Het laat zien dat, ondanks de verwoestende impact van oorlog, de verhalen van mensen overleven.

contributors.headline: Co-founder Beyond Walls I Curator I Researcher Colonial Heritage & Art Projects I Advisor I Combining Research, Art & Storytelling

projects.title: Thuis in Beeld
projects.description:
project manager of 'Thuis in Beeld': a national photography campaign related to the national remembrance day (the 15th of August 1945). In a nation wide campaign we asked the public to send one photo that represented "home" to them, accompanied by their personal story. On the 15th of August 2016, we portrayed a selection with different perceptions of 'home' in an exhibition. Alongside the photography campaign, I produced five visual short docu’s of different people with stories about their 'home'. 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZocPSYmEUMBEhImKWAlE32Gpr6yM4dgz
www.indischherinneringscentrum.nl/thuisinbeeld

projects.title: De Indische Tuin
projects.description:
Founder of De Indische Tuin: a cultural event (and online platform) -for Indo/Dutch people and all who interested- with debates, music, literature and theater. Theme of the first event: 'Old stories, New voices': the way (historical) events and recent developments shaped, influenced and changed different concepts of identity.  

Compilation of De Indische Tuin, 6th of June, 2015 (ZIMIHC Theater, Utrecht): https://vimeo.com/134854912 

facebook.com/deindischetuin
twitter.com/deindischetuin

Jurylid regeling Talentontwikkeling van het Stimuleringsfonds Creatieve Industrie.
profile_positions.title: Adviseur en Commissielid Talentontwikkeling

profile_positions.description:
Amplifying community-centered voices and resisting colonial erasures through research, storytelling and art.

The afterlives of colonialism still shape everyday life. What does (pre)colonial heritage mean in today’s world? Beyond Walls explores this question through research, art and storytelling. 

Beyond Walls is an Amsterdam-based and globally active collective of independent researchers, curators and visual storytellers. We initiate and participate in collaborative projects that structurally embed community-centered voices: from exhibitions, community projects, international collaborations and documentaries, to research, artistic interventions, and advice. Within and beyond the walls of institutions. 

Core team & founders: Suzanne Rastovac (historian, curator, concept development),Jeremy Flohr (visual storyteller, audio engineer), Armando Ello (photographer, filmmaker, publisher), Glenda Pattipeilohy (concept development, program curator, producer & educator).

Now on: 
RESEARCH INTO THE SLAVERY PAST OF EINDHOVEN 
Beyond Walls is invited to conduct and coordinate the research into the role Eindhoven played in Dutch Slavery

DICHTER BIJ ONZE KOLONIALE ERFENIS
Artists reflecting on colonial collections & exhibition Our Colonial Inheritance through art in a storytelling live performance and film. With Read My World and Tropenmuseum. 

AFTERLIVES OF REVOLUTION, part of the Rijksmuseum Exhibition Revolusi! Concept, direction: Beyond Walls. Partner: Het Rijksmuseum

SHISHANI & SISTERHOOD 
Storytelling concertfilm, partners: Erasmus Huis Jakarta & Shishani.

BETA DISINI Museum Maluku & Beyond Walls joined forces to create a (inter)national Live program on 70 years of Moluccan presence in The Netherlands & Maluku. Hosted by Rocky Hehakaija and Jeftha Pattikawa.

Expertise: concept development • curating • research • community partnerships • directing & producing • network projects • cross-disciplinary programming • visual storytelling • (international) collaborations
profile_positions.title: Co-founder BEYOND WALLS I Curator I Researcher I Historian | Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Beyond Walls is partner in the BETA DISINI Livestream, Sunday March 21. Beyond Walls developed the program concept, curated and produced the program, which included 8 program locations and 6 Livelocations. Parts of the visuals produced by Beyond Walls were broadcasted by NOS.

Projectleader & Program Curator: Suzanne Rastovac 
Ciordinator & Program Curator: Glenda Pattipeilohy
Cinematographics Concept & development: Jeremy Flohr & Armando Ello

Museum Maluku BETA DISINI (IK BEN HIER) 2021. Tussen maart en juni schijnt het museum licht op bijzondere bijdragen van Molukkers, in de wereld en in de Nederlandse samenleving in het bijzonder. Deze periode markeert de aankomst van grote groepen Molukse gezinnen precies 70 jaar geleden. Zondag 21 maart om 12:00 uur is de kick off met de gelijknamige livestream uitzending BETA DISINI, te zien via via Facebook, Youtube Live en museum-maluku.nl. De NOS besteedt diezelfde dag aandacht aan dit historische feit met een thema-uitzending. 

BETA DISINI wordt op 21 maart 2021 live uitgezonden vanuit Museum Sophiahof met een scala aan gasten op het gebied van kunst, wetenschap, educatie, sport en muziek. Ook tunen we in het land op een selectie van 6 locaties: Vught, Laarbrug, Vaassen, Rotterdam, Tiel en gaan over de grens naar Ambon met spoken word op maat van Eko Poceratu. We schijnen licht op de afgelopen decennia, tafelgesprekken over o.a. historisch bewustzijn, beeldvorming en gedeelde toekomstdromen, en performances van jonge generaties. Met BETA DISINI willen we bijdragen aan een meer evenwichtige beeldvorming van mensen met Molukse roots. Een beeldvorming die te vaak bepaald is door wat in koloniale tijden en de afgelopen 70 jaar over Molukkers is gezegd en geschreven.

BETA DISINI wordt gepresenteerd door Rocky Hehakaija & Jeftha Pattikawa. Talks met Jazzy Taihuttu, Milko Hitijahubessy, Tamara Soukotta en Joaniek Vreeswijk. Inhoudelijke programmaredactie door Wim Manuhutu. Muziek van oa Safa Liron en Rafael Sinay.

profile_positions.title: Curator public programs & publicity campaigns

profile_positions.description:
Curator public programs & projects regarding the colonial history of the Netherlands and Indonesia. From the impact of colonialism, war and migration to its meaning in todays world. How is colonial heritage represented in museums, institutions, National remembrances and public spaces? To what extend do they reflect a critical and inclusive approach? 
Specialization: - innovative concepts / cross-disciplinary collabs / curating public programming & projects / project management /  public engagement / directing & producing shortfilms

A selection of current projects: 
•HUIZEN VAN AANKOMST (NEW HOMES)
Concept I Project leader I curator

After WOII in the Pacific over 350.000 people moved from Indonesia to The Netherlands where they found a new home or migrated to other parts of the world, like Canada, Surinam, the US, South Africa and Brazil. How was it to leave ones home towards a new destination? Which stories migrated with them? On 15/8/2020 we connect people to these stories with 75 programs, readings and artist reflections.A selection of these ‘homes’ are transformed into public spaces where personal stories are shared and reflected upon. A project about migration, belonging and identity.

•BLINDE VLEKKEN (BLIND SPOTS) I Curator/concept
series of public programs about representation / inclusion within museums, in collaboration with Wereldmuseum Rotterdam.
Check: https://bit.ly/2UzvH7i

•GEPEPERD VERLEDEN I Curator/concept
series of public programs, seminars and workshops regarding decolonization in broader perspective. Collaborated with parters like Tropenmuseum, Museum Volkenkunde, Het Scheepvaartmuseum.
Check: https://bit.ly/35FdpEI

•INDIE NEXT I Curator
International program about how the colonial past is remembered in both present day Dutch and Indonesian society. With critical reflections by scholars, museum professionals, artists and keynote speakers from Indonesia.
Check: https://bit.ly/3boO9Fy

•More: https://bit.ly/32p0XXM

profile_positions.description:
Between April and July 2014 I travelled through Indonesia, Malaysia and the Philippines. I developed music education programs for young adults throughout Java and Bali, mainly at Yayasan Cipta Mandiri in Bogor, Indonesia.

Yayasan Cipta Mandiri (YCM) is an Independent Creative Foundation for children and youth in Bogor, West Java, Indonesia. Rather than being a traditional academic school, YCM is a rumah pembinaan — a house in which students are able to build their self-confidence, general knowledge, and practical skills.
profile_positions.title: Independent Music Professional I Educator

profile_positions.description:
As a legal officer, responsible for:
- Analyzing appeals lodged by members of the public or (lawyer) agencies against decisions of the Dutch Tax and Customs Administration.
- Writing statements of defense on behalf of the legal representatives of the DTCA. The disputes concerned issues regarding health care allowance, child care allowance and rental allowance.  
- Analyzing files and applying the General Administrative Law Act (Awb) and framework laws (such as Awir)
- Attending the hearings in court
- Successfully completed courses on national tax legislation.
profile_positions.title: Legal officer | Tax and Customs Administration

profile_positions.description:
At the Good Governance Division responsible for:
- Analyzing the UNHCR Iraq annual report for the Humanitarian Aid Division and writing an extensive policy memorandum on behalf of the Ministry.
- Organizing and coordinating an international EITI conferences in Amsterdam. I Worked closely together with stakeholders like embassies and Cordaid. The EITI is a global standard to promote open and accountable management of natural resources, such as oil, gas and minerals. (www.eiti.org). The conference was held at the Beurs van Berlage and the Industrieele Groote Club. For the more than hundred international participants I was one of their contactpersons, arranged accommodations, visa, transport etc. 
- Three day conference.and the cultural program in Amsterdam. 
- co-writing speeches, research on topics regarding foreign policy, drafting memoranda and preparing internal information files.
- Representing the Ministry of Foreign Affairs at inter-departmental working groups.
profile_positions.title: Policy officer | Good governance division

volunteer_experiences.description:
At ZIMIHC Stefanus, I programmed & produced cultural events. 

ZIMIHC Theater provides a stage for development of art and culture with a particular focus on starting artists, poets, street art, students of art, musicians and theater groups. ZIMIHC connects high class international events with local art communities.

With over 26 years of experience organising projects and events, ZIMIHC was born out of the need for places where (amateur) artists can perform and rehearse. Today the organisation founded in the Dutch city of Utrecht boasts three theatres and a broad professional network that allows (amateur and street) artists the opportunity and room necessary in order for their talents to flourish and evolve optimally.

Worked on a project to digitalize the archives of the Moluccan-Dutch history with a particular focus on the period during and after the Second World War in SEA.

Museum Maluku (now Stichting Moluks Historisch Museum) was a museum dedicated to the (history of) Maluku Islands, Moluccan historical heritage and the Moluccans community living in the Netherlands. Museum Maluku was located in the city of Utrecht.

Worked as a coordinator of weekly cultural events in Utrecht city. Vluchtelingenwerk Midden-Nederland started this project 12 years ago with the purpose of creating a cultural meeting spot where refugees and (local) Dutch people could meet and interact with each other in an informal setting.

company.name: Liga voor de Rechten van de Mens

volunteer_experiences.description:
In 2006 I was a member of a debating group in Amsterdam on international human rights issues. We worked on a project to realize a textbook about human rights for children and discussed about how human rights could be included in the national curriculum.
